com.esri.mo2.map.prj
Class LayerSourceRegistry

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.prj.LayerSourceRegistry
public class LayerSourceRegistry
extends Object

This class provides a way to plug-in different kinds of LayerSource to the XML code that handles AXL project de/serialization (mo2.xml.prj package). Developers can add support for a new type of LayerSource by implementing LayerSourceFactory, then registering it within this class. Subsequent use of Layers, constructed by the LayerSource, that are loaded into a Map, causes appropriate AXL to be written-to/read-from an AXL project file.

To register a new LayerSourceRegistry, a unique (String) key must be devised, then an instance of LayerSourceRegistry must be added using addFactory(). A good strategy for developing an appropriate key is to use the full class name of the LayerSource that the factory constructs. For example, a LayerSourceFactory for the com.esri.mo2.file.shp.ShapefileFolder LayerSource could be registered using the following:

 static {
       LayerSourceRegistry.addFactory(
               ShapefileFolder.FOLDER_TYPE,
               new ShapefileFolderFactory()
       );
   }
where FOLDER_TYPE is a string constant that defines value of the type attribute of FOLDER tag for a shape file datasource.

Constructor Detail

public LayerSourceRegistry()
Method Detail

addFactory

public static void addFactory(String key,
                              LayerSourceFactory factory)
adds the given factory to this registry, with specified lookup key. The key must be unique with respect to other factory objects. If a factory already exists for the given key, it will be (quietly) replaced

Parameters:
key - a unique key used to obtain the factory object
factory - the factory to be added

removeFactory

public static LayerSourceFactory removeFactory(String key)
removes a factory from this registry, for the given key

Parameters:
key - the key used to identify the factory object to be removed
Returns:
the factory object that was removed, or null == no factory was found that corresponded with the given key

keyIterator

public static Iterator keyIterator()
Returns a read-only iterator for all factory object keys within this registry

Returns:
the iterator of keys

factoryIterator

public static Iterator factoryIterator()
Returns a read-only iterator for all factory objects within this registry

Returns:
the iterator of factory objects

getFactory

public static LayerSourceFactory getFactory(String key)
Obtains a factory object for the given key.

Parameters:
key - the key of the factory to be obtained
Returns:
the factory object, or null == factory object key is not registered
